metadata.title: CVE-2020-14771 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Security: LDAP Auth). Supported versions that are affected are5.7.31 and prior and 8.0.21 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerabilityallows high privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocolsto compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized ability to cause a partial denial of service(partial DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 2.2 (Availabilityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14771` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-client - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-router - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-server - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.22-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
